content.description: This is a nice crack climb, lost in the wilderness behind Sholan Farms. The name of this route was posted on Rockclimbing.com. I have climbed it, and it is fun. Follow the gradually widening crack to an easy top-out.
content.protection: The gear is good, but I'm not sure what would happen if a cam caught a fall and levered the rock. The formation on the left of the crack is a tooth-shaped boulder which might separate from the cliff. Large nuts and or hexes might be a better option. Trees on top make an adequate anchor.
content.location: This is on the left-hand side of the crag to the left of an obvious corner.

content.description: This terrific line climbs up the most featured portion of the wall using a dynamic set of moves and holds. Start with your hands on the furthest right set of holds in the horizontal crack, and work your way left to a large gaston/sidepull rail. Continue straight up from there with one more big move, done either with a crimp out right and a very high left foot, or a committing deadpoint nearly 20 feet off the deck. The topout is fairly easy but still a little freaky so high off the ground.We also did a direct start that adds a neat move, marginally more difficult.The FA was done as a boulder problem but done on toprope as well.
content.location: Begin on the center-right on the main face of the cliff, starting with both of your hands on the furthest right set of holds in the horizontal crack.

content.description: Starting on the same holds as for Sholan Showdown, this dynamic route heads up the much more blank section of the wall on the far right side. After established on the first few holds, get a high foot out left, and reach to a lefthand sidepull pretty high up. Work up and slightly to the right to a very good left hand crimp and a mediocre right hand, and from here, make a sizable jump to the lip of the rock. From here, it would be nice to top out directly, but there was far too much lichen for that, so we opted to traverse out left to meet with the top out of Sholan Showdown.
content.protection: Pads, potentially this could be TR'ed.
content.location: Starting on the same holds as Sholan Showdown, work straight up the face before traversing out left to top out.

content.description: There is an open project on the blank face 15 feet to the right of First Impressions. Getting off the ground is the crux as the crimps are small and terrible and the feet nonexistent. Holds get larger as you climb higher towards an obvious huge roof but they are never "great". Bring your iron fingers to send this one.... It's still awaiting a FA.
content.protection: Primarily a TR problem but may take a small nut in the center of the face where the seam gets larger then a small TCU before the overhang.
content.location: This is 15 feet right of the First Impressions corner on a seemingly blank 20 feet face capped by a large roof.

content.description:
Interesting climbing with a tricky crux at an overhanging bulge. Stem the right facing corner to the right of Tooth to a tricky bulge. Surmount the bulge, then traverse left with the finger crack to an easier topout. 

  This route requires a lot of cleaning but has interesting moves and mostly good rock.
content.protection: Small cams and one alpine draw to sling a small tree.
content.location: It ascends a right-facing corner with an obvious bulge crux approximately ten feet up.

content.description: The problem runs right up the middle of the boulder from an obvious ledge and goes to a series of deep jugs. The topout is a little sketchy. Multiple pads are needed.
content.location: From Upper North Road, walk the main trail until you hit the trail for Devil's Pulpit, then hang a right towards the rock outcrops on the yellow blazed trail. Follow yellow blazed trail for 100 yard. As the trail goes uphill, the boulder will off to the right.

content.description: The crux is right in the middle of the problem as you pull yourself up over the bulge. The landing to this problem slopes downhill, so having a spotter there to stop you from sliding down the hill is recommended.
content.location: The problem is to the left of Everything's a Jug. Begin with your eft hand on a lower slot and your right hand on an incut hold.

content.description: A large parcel of public land which includes the apple orchard and miles of trails behind it. There are numerous, scattered boulders, mostly of poor quality. There is a small cliff approximately 20 minutes hike from the main parking lot with decent route potential. Locals have described other rocks including a house-sized boulder that I have not been able to find. There are over 30 miles of trails here. At least one route has been established here according to rockclimbing.com.
